title: Phase 4: US1 - Local Development Testing
description:
Enable developers to authenticate once and run tests locally with persisted credentials.

User Story: As a local developer, I want to authenticate once via browser OAuth and have my credentials persist so I can run Tier B tests repeatedly without re-authentication.

Goals:
- Implement CredentialManager for loading/saving/refreshing tokens
- Implement OAuthFlow with local callback server
- Create bootstrap_oauth.py interactive setup script
- Support LOCAL_FILE credential source with .credentials/token.json

Tasks: T030-T047 (18 tasks)
Depends on: Phase 3 complete
Independent test: Run bootstrap_oauth.py → authenticate → run pytest → tests pass without re-auth

title: T030: [P] Implement CredentialManager class
description:
Implement CredentialManager class skeleton in src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/credential_manager.py.

Class structure:
- __init__(source: CredentialSource)
- load_credentials() → OAuthCredentials | None
- save_credentials(creds: OAuthCredentials)
- refresh_access_token(creds: OAuthCredentials) → OAuthCredentials
- get_credentials_for_testing() → OAuthCredentials | None (convenience method)

Why: Central class for all credential management operations. Abstracts credential loading from different sources.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/credential_manager.py
Epic: Phase 4 (extended-google-doc-utils-0mn)
User Story: US1
Dependencies: Phase 3 complete
close_reason: Implemented CredentialManager class skeleton with all required methods: OAuthCredentials dataclass updated, CredentialSourceDetector and CredentialManager classes added with proper structure and documentation

title: T039: Implement exchange_code_for_tokens()
description:
Implement exchange_code_for_tokens() in OAuthFlow.

Logic:
- Use google-auth-oauthlib to exchange authorization code
- Get access token, refresh token, token expiry
- Return OAuthCredentials

Why: Completes OAuth flow by converting authorization code to usable credentials.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/oauth_flow.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T031

title: T040: Create bootstrap_oauth.py script
description:
Create bootstrap_oauth.py script skeleton in scripts/.

Structure:
- main() function
- Command line argument parsing
- Call OAuthFlow.run_interactive_flow()
- Call CredentialManager.save_credentials()

Why: Entry point for developers to set up OAuth. Interactive script guides through authentication.

Files: scripts/bootstrap_oauth.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T030, T031 (classes must exist)

title: T041: Add interactive prompts to bootstrap_oauth.py
description:
Add interactive prompts and instructions to bootstrap_oauth.py.

Include:
- Welcome message explaining OAuth flow
- Prompt for client_id and client_secret
- Instructions for Google Cloud Console setup
- Browser launch notification

Why: Makes OAuth setup user-friendly for developers unfamiliar with Google APIs.

Files: scripts/bootstrap_oauth.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T040 (script must exist)

title: T042: Add credential validation test API call
description:
Add credential validation test API call in bootstrap_oauth.py.

Logic:
- After saving credentials, make test API call (Drive about.get)
- Verify credentials work
- Display success message with user email

Why: Immediate feedback that OAuth flow succeeded and credentials are valid.

Files: scripts/bootstrap_oauth.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T040

title: T043: Output credentials in environment variable format
description:
Output credentials in environment variable format in bootstrap_oauth.py.

Output:
export GOOGLE_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID="..."
export GOOGLE_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET="..."
export GOOGLE_OAUTH_REFRESH_TOKEN="..."

Why: Enables easy credential setup for CI/CD environments. Copy-paste into GitHub Secrets or .env files.

Files: scripts/bootstrap_oauth.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T040

Error scenarios:

- Invalid credentials → message with troubleshooting steps

Why: Provides clear guidance when credentials fail. Reduces developer frustration.

description:
Implement OAuthFlow class skeleton in src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/oauth_flow.py.

Class structure:
- __init__(client_id: str, client_secret: str, scopes: list[str])
- run_interactive_flow() → OAuthCredentials
- exchange_code_for_tokens(auth_code: str) → OAuthCredentials

Why: Handles the OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow for desktop applications.

Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: Phase 3 complete

title: T032: Implement load_credentials() for LOCAL_FILE
description:
Implement load_credentials() method for LOCAL_FILE source in CredentialManager.

Logic:
- Check .credentials/token.json exists
- Load JSON file
- Parse into OAuthCredentials
- Handle file not found gracefully (return None)

Why: Enables developers to load persisted credentials from local file system.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/credential_manager.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T030 (CredentialManager class must exist)
close_reason: Implemented load_credentials() for LOCAL_FILE source with comprehensive Tier A tests. The method loads credentials from .credentials/token.json, handles missing files gracefully by returning None, and properly parses JSON into OAuthCredentials dataclass.

title: T033: Implement save_credentials() for LOCAL_FILE
description:
Implement save_credentials() method for LOCAL_FILE in CredentialManager.

Logic:
- Create .credentials/ directory if not exists
- Serialize OAuthCredentials to JSON
- Write to .credentials/token.json
- Set file permissions to 0600 (owner read/write only)

Why: Enables developers to persist credentials after OAuth flow for reuse across test runs.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/credential_manager.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T030

title: T034: Implement refresh_access_token()
description:
Implement refresh_access_token() method using google.auth in CredentialManager.

Logic:
- Use google.auth.transport.requests
- Refresh access token using refresh token
- Update token_expiry
- Return updated OAuthCredentials

Why: Automatically refreshes expired access tokens without requiring user re-authentication.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/credential_manager.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T030

title: T035: Implement get_credentials_for_testing()
description:
Implement get_credentials_for_testing() convenience method in CredentialManager.

Logic:
- Call load_credentials()
- If access token expired, call refresh_access_token()
- Return ready-to-use credentials

Why: Simplifies credential retrieval in pytest fixtures. One-line method for tests to get valid credentials.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/credential_manager.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T032, T034 (load and refresh must exist)

title: T036: Implement run_interactive_flow() for desktop OAuth
description:
Implement run_interactive_flow() for desktop OAuth in OAuthFlow.

Steps:
1. Start local callback server
2. Generate authorization URL
3. Open browser to authorization URL
4. Wait for callback with authorization code
5. Exchange code for tokens
6. Return OAuthCredentials

Why: Enables browser-based OAuth flow for local developers. User authenticates once, credentials are saved.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/oauth_flow.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T031 (OAuthFlow class must exist)

title: T037: Implement local callback server
description:
Implement local callback server in src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/oauth_flow.py.

Implementation:
- Use http.server.HTTPServer
- Simple handler to capture ?code= parameter
- Return success HTML page to user
- Timeout after 5 minutes

Why: Required for OAuth authorization code flow. Receives redirect from Google after user authentication.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/oauth_flow.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T031

title: T038: Add port fallback logic (8080-8089)
description:
Add port fallback logic (8080-8089) for callback server.

Logic:
- Try port 8080 first
- If in use, try 8081, 8082... up to 8089
- Raise error if all ports in use

Why: Handles port conflicts gracefully. Multiple developers or test runs won't block each other.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/oauth_flow.py
Epic: Phase 4
User Story: US1
Dependencies: T037 (callback server must exist)

title: Phase 9: US3 - Cloud Agent Testing
description:
Enable cloud agents to run Tier A tests and skip Tier B tests with clear messaging.

User Story: As a cloud agent without credential access, I want to run Tier A tests and see clear skip messages for Tier B so I can contribute code changes without API credentials.

Goals:
- Add CLOUD_AGENT environment variable detection
- Update credential source selection for cloud agents
- Add clear skip messages for Tier B tests
- Document cloud agent setup

Tasks: T103-T108 (6 tasks)
Depends on: Phase 3 complete (can run after US0)
Independent test: Set CLOUD_AGENT=true → Tier A passes, Tier B skips gracefully

title: T103: Add CLOUD_AGENT environment variable detection
description:
Add CLOUD_AGENT environment variable detection in EnvironmentType.detect().

Logic:
- Check os.environ.get('CLOUD_AGENT')
- If set (any value), return EnvironmentType.CLOUD_AGENT
- Update detect() priority: CLOUD_AGENT > GITHUB_ACTIONS > LOCAL

Why: Enables cloud agents to identify themselves. Different credential source selection.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/utils/config.py
Epic: Phase 9 (extended-google-doc-utils-2sz)
User Story: US3
Dependencies: Phase 3 complete (EnvironmentType must exist)

title: T104: Update credential source selection for cloud agents
description:
Update credential source selection logic for cloud agents.

Logic:
- If CLOUD_AGENT environment → return CredentialSource.NONE
- Cloud agents only run Tier A tests
- Clear log message: "Cloud agent mode: Tier B tests will be skipped"

Why: Cloud agents shouldn't require credentials. Enables contribution without API access.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/auth/credential_manager.py or utils/config.py
Epic: Phase 9
User Story: US3
Dependencies: T103 (CLOUD_AGENT detection must exist)

Skip message format:

"To run Tier B tests, use local development with bootstrap_oauth.py"

Why: Informative skip messages. Cloud agents understand why tests are skipped.

Files: tests/conftest.py
Epic: Phase 9
User Story: US3
Dependencies: T104 (cloud agent credential logic must exist)

title: Phase 8: US5 - Test Resource Isolation
description:
Enable parallel test execution with dynamic resource creation and unique identifiers.

User Story: As a developer running tests in parallel, I want each test to create unique Google Docs resources with automatic cleanup so tests don't interfere with each other.

Goals:
- Implement TestResourceManager with unique ID generation
- Create context managers for isolated documents/folders
- Implement best-effort cleanup with session teardown
- Create manual cleanup script for orphaned resources

Tasks: T085-T102 (18 tasks)
Depends on: Phase 6 complete
Independent test: Run multiple test suites simultaneously → each creates unique resources with minimal conflicts

title: T085: [P] Implement TestResourceMetadata dataclass
description:
Implement TestResourceMetadata dataclass in src/extended_google_doc_utils/utils/test_resources.py.

Fields:
- resource_id: str (Google Drive file ID)
- resource_type: ResourceType (document, folder)
- title: str (original title)
- created_at: datetime
- test_name: str (which test created it)

Why: Tracks test-created resources for cleanup. Metadata enables orphaned resource identification.

Files: src/extended_google_doc_utils/utils/test_resources.py
Epic: Phase 8 (extended-google-doc-utils-3kj)
User Story: US5
Dependencies: Phase 6 complete (API clients exist)

    # use doc_id for testing
# automatic cleanup on exit

Why: Pythonic API for resource isolation. Ensures cleanup even if test fails.

def cleanup_test_resources(resource_manager):

Why: Ensures resources are cleaned up even if tests fail. Prevents accumulation of test resources.

title: Phase 10: Polish - Production Readiness

Cross-cutting improvements for production release readiness.

Goals:
- Add comprehensive type hints and docstrings
- Configure pre-commit hooks (formatting, linting, credential prevention)

Performance validation: Pre-flight check <2s, proof-of-concept test <5s.

- Pre-flight check timing (target: <2s)
- Proof-of-concept test timing (target: <5s)
- Full Tier B test suite (target: <10 minutes)

Document results and optimize if needed.

Why: Ensures performance goals are met. Fast feedback loops improve developer experience.

Files: Performance validation documentation
Epic: Phase 10
Dependencies: Phase 5, Phase 6 complete (pre-flight and POC must exist)

title: T125: Security audit
description:
Security audit: Verify no credentials in git history or public files.

Audit checklist:
- git log --all --full-history -- '.credentials/*' (should be empty)
- grep -r 'client_secret' . (should only find documentation/comments)
- Verify .gitignore includes .credentials/
- Check GitHub Actions logs for secret exposure
- Verify pre-commit hook prevents credential commits

Why: Critical security validation. Prevents credential leaks that could compromise accounts.

Files: Security audit report
Epic: Phase 10
Dependencies: All phases complete

title: T128: Final end-to-end testing across all environments
description:
Final end-to-end testing across all three environments.

Test matrix:
1. Local development:
   - Run bootstrap_oauth.py
   - Run pytest (both tiers)
   - Verify all tests pass

2. GitHub Actions:
   - Create test PR
   - Verify Tier A auto-runs
   - Trigger Tier B with approval
   - Verify all workflows pass

3. Cloud agent simulation:
   - Set CLOUD_AGENT=true
   - Run pytest
   - Verify Tier A passes, Tier B skipped gracefully

Why: Comprehensive validation. Ensures entire system works across all deployment scenarios.

Files: Testing validation report
Epic: Phase 10
Dependencies: All phases complete

- src/extended_google_doc_utils/ (main package)
- tests/ (test directory)
- scripts/ (utility scripts)
- .credentials/ (for local OAuth tokens, must be gitignored)

Why: Establishes the foundational directory structure for the entire project. The src/ layout prevents accidental imports of development code and ensures clean package installation.

title: T002: Initialize pyproject.toml with uv and dependencies

- google-auth-httplib2 (API authentication)
- google-api-python-client (Docs/Drive APIs)
- pytest (testing framework)
- pytest-mock (mocking for Tier A tests)

Why: Defines the project metadata, dependencies, and build configuration. Using uv for fast, modern Python package management.

Dependencies: T001

title: T004: [P] Create .gitignore for credentials and cache
description:
Create .gitignore excluding sensitive files and build artifacts.

Must exclude:
- .credentials/ (OAuth tokens - CRITICAL for security)
- __pycache__/ *.pyc (Python bytecode)
- .pytest_cache/ (pytest cache)
- htmlcov/ .coverage (coverage reports)
- .venv/ venv/ (virtual environments)
- uv.lock (may be excluded for libraries)

Why: Prevents credential leaks and keeps repository clean. The .credentials/ exclusion is critical for security - OAuth tokens must never be committed.

Files: .gitignore (repository root)
Epic: Phase 1
Dependencies: None (can run in parallel)

title: Phase 5: US2.5 - Credential Pre-Flight Check
description:
Validate credentials before running any Tier B tests to provide fast failure (<2s) with clear error messages.

User Story: As a developer, I want immediate feedback if my credentials are invalid so I don't waste time running tests that will fail.

Goals:
- Implement PreflightCheck class with lightweight Drive API call
- Create session-scoped pytest fixture
- Auto-skip Tier B tests when pre-flight fails
- Display bootstrap command instructions in error messages

title: Phase 7: US2 - GitHub Actions CI/CD Testing
description:
Enable automated testing in GitHub Actions with environment-based credentials and approval gates.

User Story: As a maintainer, I want Tier A tests to run automatically on all PRs and Tier B tests to require my approval so credentials stay protected from untrusted code.

Goals:
- Implement ENVIRONMENT credential source
- Create tier-a-tests.yml workflow (auto-run on all PRs)
- Create tier-b-tests.yml workflow (requires environment protection)
- Document GitHub Environment setup for credential secrets

title: T072: Implement load_credentials() for ENVIRONMENT source
description:
Implement load_credentials() for ENVIRONMENT source in CredentialManager.

- Read GOOGLE_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET env var
- Read GOOGLE_OAUTH_REFRESH_TOKEN env var
- Return OAuthCredentials or None if any missing

Why: Enables credential loading from GitHub Secrets in CI/CD environments.

title: Phase 6: US4 - Proof of Concept Integration Test
description:
Validate end-to-end OAuth and API integration by reading the 'Gondwana' document.

User Story: As a developer, I want a simple proof-of-concept test that validates the entire authentication and API chain so I know the infrastructure works end-to-end.

Goals:
- Implement GoogleDocsClient and GoogleDriveClient
- Create methods for document retrieval and text extraction
- Write proof-of-concept test reading document ID 1t8YEJ57mfNbvE85tQjFDmPmLAvRX1v307teKfXc09T4
- Verify test returns 'Gondwana' as first word

Depends on: Phase 4 and Phase 5 complete
Independent test: Run test against Gondwana document → returns 'Gondwana'

title: T058: [P] Implement GoogleDocsClient class
description:
Implement GoogleDocsClient class skeleton in src/extended_google_doc_utils/google_api/docs_client.py.

Class structure:
- __init__(credentials: OAuthCredentials)
- get_document(document_id: str) → dict
- extract_text(document: dict) → str
- extract_first_word(document: dict) → str
- create_document(title: str) → str (returns document_id)

Why: Provides high-level API for Google Docs operations. Abstracts google-api-python-client complexity.
